page.title: 13INTERVIEW-continued
page.content: This,he feels,has created a conflict of interests between himself and the 'newcomers'.As a farmer he feels people moving to a rural area for peace and a less restricted way of life should appreciate that the land around them is the site and source of a commercial enterprise and investment (just as a factory site would be thought of in an urban area).Nagging complaints about footpath blockages, mud on the road and early morning noisy milking machinery are constant irritants in this farmer's life and isolate him from what should be his own community. The only village event of the year is the 'harvest supper',a somewhat false and stilted affair in the eyes of this man,where the ageing and non- farming inhabitants attempt to recreate the togetherness of the past.
